name: Dangerous Liaisons
description: Dangerous Liaisons is a movie starring Glenn Close, John Malkovich, and Michelle Pfeiffer. A scheming widow and her manipulative ex-lover make a bet regarding the corruption of a recently married woman.

review.name: A bad attempt to make a French movie
review.reviewBody:
Even if we forgive the fact that the book is different from the movie

and that some liberties should not be taken by a screenwriter. But

even if all that aside, this still does not explain lack of character

development, lack of emotional charge through the movie and lack

of French manners and ways of life that should be a background to

any movie set in France. Who ever hoots in a theater in France?

What music teacher (not that he is a music teacher in a book)

could challenge a nobleman? What about just the general charm

and etiquette of French nobility that despite all of their wickedness

is still the predominant mask? Where was that? Perhaps John

Malkovich was the wrong actor to try to display a combination of a

seducer and a charmer all at the same time. As far as Michelle

Pfeiffer, well she is beautiful as always and she fit the role she

was given..her typical role. The virtuous, sweet woman who tries to

control things but fails. This is her role in every single movie she is

in and she is good in that role, but unfortunately does not go any

further in developing it. Keeanu Reeves is terrible and

undeveloped as a character and I can't believe the only point of

Uma Thurman was for the nudity. I mean she can act and they

could have made her into a stronger character to illustrate all the

emotions and changes she had to go through. As far as Glenn

Close, I also thought that the emotional load of the movie, of her

character was not passed on to the viewer because of her weak

performance or weak writing. This movie could of been great if

made by the French who could not only understand the novel

better but also allow the viewers to taste France and that time

period in all its beauty and bitterness. To make people feel the

function of women as victims and at the same time see that not all

was quite that simple. This movie was made in two dimensions

and it needed at least one more in order to live up to the novel.

However, it turned out to be a typical, wanna be Blockbuster flick

with a little bit more of an interesting story line.
